p: The third largest non-B cluster included 1404 subtype A6 sequences including 4 NCC sequences, 250 LANL sequences directly linked to 1 of these 4 sequences, and 1150 additional LANL sequences [ 29]. Most of these sequences were from countries of the former Soviet Union (FSU) ( Table 2). Molecular dating of this cluster using relaxed clock methods proved difficult. Bayesian estimates of cluster tMRCA were sensitive to the model of population size dynamics and showed wide CIs (1939; HPD, 1901â€“1969). Our analyses included many sequences outside the FSU, hence its results are not directly comparable to previous, FSU-focused, estimates. No significant evidence of onward transmission was found within the NCC ( Supplementary Figure 6).
